text: After all, it is the divinity within that makes the divinity without and I have been more fascinated by a woman of talent and intelligence, though deficient in personal charms, than I have been by the most regular beauty.
author: Washington Irving

text: Do not try to push your way through to the front ranks of your profession do not run after distinctions and rewards but do your utmost to find an entry into the world of beauty.
author: Sydney Smith

text: All cities are mad: but the madness is gallant. All cities are beautiful: but the beauty is grim.
author: Christopher Morley

text: Whether you come from heaven or hell, what does it matter, O Beauty!
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: People think that if you look fairly reasonable, you can't possibly act, and as I only care about acting, I think beauty can be a great handicap.
author: Vivien Leigh
